intro.description: Managed by passionate volunteers both in and around the campus, TEDxUTsukuba has shed light on relevant topics - from liberal arts to science, local stories to global issues.

covid19-info.title: Our Response to COVID-19
covid19-info.description1: To protect the health and safety of our community, we are following the guidelines from university officials alongside with local authorities.
covid19-info.description2: We continue to prioritize preventing the spread of virus and ensuring the safety of all those involved, and implement additional measures based on the directions of the government and local authorities. Please also check the infection control measures of the University of Tsukuba, Ibaraki Prefecture and Tsukuba City.

event.title: Event arrangement
event.s1: Transforming our on-site events to virtual hostings.
event.s2: Ensuring ventilation and physical distancing while recording an streaming.
event.s3: Adjusting schedule to avoid gathering in one place.
event.s4: Using partitions in the circumstances where we take off face coverings.

org.title: Working environment
org.s2: Avoiding close contact when meeting in person. Ensuring adequate ventilation and air conditioning.
org.s3: Encouraging all the members to measure their temperature every day. If they don't feel well, they are advised to stay at home and refrain from involving any activities.
org.s4: Wearing face coverings and using hand sanitizers. Equipments are wiped well before use.
org.s5: Contacting with our speakers, performers and partners with all these in mind.

news.title: News & Updates
news.subtitle: Get the latest news and updates from TEDxUTsukuba.

left.title: Spotlight your business like never before.

center.title: Sign up for one-day volunteer and host a special event together.

right.title: Share your insight that surprises the world.

blog.subtitle: Hear the thoughts and ideas from our members.
blog.thanks: Thank you for reading this article to the end.
blog.disclaimer: The opinions expressed in this article are those of the authors and do not necessarily reflect the views of TEDxUTsukuba.

university.title:
University of
Tsukuba
university.description: University of Tsukuba is one of the top research-intensive universities and the oldest higher educations in Japan. The history dates back to the Normal School, founded in 1872 and chartered in 1886. With the campus relocation in 1973, Tsukuba has transformed itself into an interdisciplinary, transborder and open university for all. Today, Tsukuba is known as a home for students, a hub for researchers, a field for athletes, and an incubator for entrepreneurs.

description.1: About TEDx, x = independently organized event. In the spirit of ideas worth spreading, TEDx is a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. At a TEDx event, TED Talks video and live speakers combine to spark deep discussion and connection. These local, self-organized events are branded TEDx, where x = independently organized TED event. The TED Conference provides general guidance for the TEDx program, but individual TEDx events are self-organized. (Subject to certain rules and regulations.)
description.2: About TED. TED is a nonprofit organization devoted to Ideas Worth Spreading. Started as a four-day conference in California 30 years ago, TED has grown to support its mission with multiple initiatives. The two annual TED Conferences invite the world's leading thinkers and doers to speak for 18 minutes or less. Many of these talks are then made available, free, at TED.com. TED speakers have included Bill Gates, Jane Goodall, Elizabeth Gilbert, Sir Richard Branson, Nandan Nilekani, Philippe Starck, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, Sal Khan and Daniel Kahneman.
description.3: Since 2016, TEDxUTsukuba has been an independently-organized TEDx community in the University of Tsukuba. We are made up of a diverse group of students and alumni with curiosity and advocacy. As the theme for the 2020 event "JIJIMUGE" represents the spirit of perceiving a complex world as it is, we aim to be a catalyst for change by spreading out diverse values and inspiring ideas.
description.5: Our motto "Social Capital" refers to the idea that each and every one of our members deserves respect and mutual trust enhances the cohesion of the organization. The challenges we face today is so complicated that we need to build solidarity across our difference. At the University of Tsukuba, people from a variety of disciplines come together on one campus to study, research, and work. In this diverse community, we aim to be a bridge that connects people through ideas worth spreading.

members.title: Members
members.subtitle: Managed by passionate volunteers, TEDxUTsukuba have been delivering mind-blowing event experience for a decade.

team.title: Team
team.subtitle: Each team has a number of unique expertise and experience.

join.title: Interested in joining us?
join.subtitle: Step forward to where the magic happens. Contact us!
join.description: Send us an email (English is available). We will arrange 1on1 Zoom meeting to discuss how you work with us and what we can offer you. If you want, we can invite you to our weekly meeting.
join.springshinkan: Every spring, we hold "Shinkan" welcome events. These events are mainly for new students but anyone can join. Stay tuned on our social media.

membership.title: Membership
membership.quote: By becoming a TED Member, you’ll be on the frontier of a brighter future, helping us build a community united by the power of knowledge.
membership.description: TED Membership has new features of TED as a way to connect more deeply with our most dedicated fans. You'll get access to exclusive monthly members-only events, including special conversations with some of the most brilliant TED speakers.

partners.title: Partners
partners.subtitle: Our event is made possible through generous support from our partners. We are working together under the shared values and vision.

talks.title: Talks
talks.subtitle: We have shed light on relevant topics - from liberal arts to science, local stories to global issues.
talks.notice: Our talks at TEDxUTsukuba 2020 "JIJIMUGE" are currently being reviewed by TED and will be availbale on YouTube soon.

speaker.title: Speakers
speaker.description: We invite four speakers with brilliant ideas.

sp1.name: Takeharu Mikami
sp1.description: The fifth editor-in-chief of Mu, a magazine that challenges the mysteries and wonders of the world, including UFOs and supernatural phenomena. He uses a surprisingly authentic approach to the truth, showing us a world that we don’t usually get to see. His trademark sunglasses give off a mysterious vibe

sp2.name: SeungHee Lee
sp2.description: Associate Professor at the University of Tsukuba in pursuit of compassionate design. Disseminating “Kansei” to the world through interdisciplinary research that focuses on human sensitivity. Surprising interests include martial arts and competitive dancing.

sp3.name: Seita Emori
sp3.description: Climate change expert and deputy director of the Center for Global Environmental Research at the National Institute for Environmental Studies. Thinking daily about how to communicate with others to help solve the problem of climate change. He loves Pokémon!

sp4.name: Carina Miwa Yoshimura
sp4.description: Japanese-Paraguayan "Sansei", came to Japan to study at University of Tsukuba. While in school, she was able to communicate the charm of Paraguay, mainly in Tsukuba, and at the same time, worked hard to support Nikkei communities across the country. "By keep learning new idea, my world expand."

concept.title: Theme
concept.description: Our event concept is "JIJIMUGE", which is derived from a Buddhism term.
concept.headline: JIJIMUGE
concept.statement1: 今、世の中にある様々な境界線が溶けつつあります。
concept.statement2: 今、世の中にある様々な境界線が溶けつつあります。
concept.statement3: 今、世の中にある様々な境界線が溶けつつあります。

participance.title: Programme
participance.description: Stay home and join our virtual event online.

free.title: Talk Session
free.intro: Watch our livestream on YouTube Live!

premium.title: Interaction Session
premium.intro: Enjoy conversations with speakers, get foods of our partners!

venue.title: Broadcasting Site
venue.headline: University of Tsukuba, Empowerment Studio
venue.description: Due to the ongoing health crisis, we delivered our annual conference in a virtual setting. Talks were pre-recorded and broadcasted alongside the interactive session at the Empowerment Studio, the world class facility for virtual reality research & development, constructed in 2015. We deeply appreciate everyone who worked together with us to make this happen.
venue.access: From bus stop 6 at the Tsukuba Center, take the bus bound for "Tsukuba Daigaku Chuo" or "the University Loop-line On-campus Bus" [Tsukuba Daigaku Junkan Bus] (clockwise) to "Dai-San Area Mae".

speaker.title: Speakers
speaker.description: 5名のスピーカーの皆さまによる価値あるアイディアをお届けいたします。

sp1.name: 松島壮志
sp1.description: Takeshi Matsushima who is a bartender has given his guests happiness through alcohol. In order to offer this extreme service, he had continually thought what is human happiness and mental abundance? Eventually, he found the answer to the question.

sp2.name: 山田玲司
sp2.description: As a manga artist, Yamada Reiji has interviewed more than 400 talented people. He has discovered the source of their talents from his experience and has written many books to convey it.

sp3.name: Leonid Dimaano
sp3.position: Exchange Student to the University of Tsukuba
sp3.description: 生物資源学類4年生でフィリピンからの留学生のLeonid Dimaanoさん。環境問題に関心を持っている彼は、先進国である日本の環境問題に対する意識の低さに驚いた。そこでechoという団体を立ち上げ環境に優しい大学を目指して日々活動している。

sp4.name: Annet Nakkazi
sp4.position: Exchange Student to the University of Tsukuba
sp4.description: 生物学類4年生でウガンダからの留学生のAnnet Nakkaziさん。母国では非常に致死率の高いガンの研究をするために筑波大学に来た。日本でアルバイトをして貯めたお金でウガンダに土地を買い、植林するプロジェクトを行なっている。

sp5.name: Carol Inugai Dixon
sp5.description: Carol Inugai Dixon is currently a guest professor at the University of Tsukuba and President of the Japan Association of Research into International Baccalaureate Education (JARIBE). Her current research interests concern the connection between social emotional wellbeing and the development of ethical values.

welcome.title: Welcome Session
welcome.description: パートナーの皆さまによる展示に話が弾みます。

perf1.title: Performace
perf1.description: 筑波大生・桐書藝団の皆さまによる圧巻の書道パフォーマンス。イベントのテーマ"CoPhilAction"を解釈した素敵なメッセージを綴っていただきました。

talk1.title: Talk Session
talk1.description: トークセッションは松島壮志さんのトークから始まりました。Leonid DimaanoさんとAnnet Nakkaziさんのトークは、オーディエンスの皆さんにどんな気づきを与えてくれたのでしょう。

workshop.title: Workshop
workshop.description: TEDxUTsukuba イチオシのワークショップ。オーディエンスの皆さまにスタッフも混ざって、クリエイティブな時間を過ごしました。

talk2.title: Talk Session
talk2.description: 質問や感想をスクリーンに送信できる"Comment Screen"を活用し、トークの合間にはインタラクティブなセッションを設けました。

perf2.title: Performance
perf2.description: よさこいサークル「斬桐舞」によるパフォーマンス。

afterparty.title: After Party
afterparty.description: パートナーの皆さまからご提供いただいた地域の食材を味わいながら、スピーカーの方々も交えての交流会となりました。

venue.title: Venue
venue.headline: University of Tsukuba, 5C Building
venue.access: Take a bus bound for Tsukuba University Central or Tsukuba University Circulation (Clockwise) from Bus Stop No. 6 at Tsukuba Center Bus Terminal, and get off at Tsukuba University Nishi Bus Stop, then walk 5 minutes from the bus stop.
venue.description: Built as the first school building, 5C Building has been the landmark of campus and the epicenter of creativity. From the pedestrian corridor, you can see a spectacular view of plaster statues.

sp1.name: Chisaki Nishimori
sp1.position: SB.Lab創設者 / ITコンサルタント / 筑波大学心理学類卒
sp1.description: 筑波大学在学中に児童擁護施設や東北でのボランティア活動に取り組む。 2016年「ソーシャルビジネスを将来の選択肢の一つに。」を合言葉にした学生団体SB Lab.を立ち上げ、同年夏、TOMODACHI-Microsoft iLEAP Social Innovation and Leadership Programに参加し、「自分自身を認める」ことの大切さに気づく。 大学卒業後はITコンサルティング会社に勤務。

sp2.name: Kazuyoshi Watari
sp2.position: 筑波大学芸術系准教授
sp2.description: 筑波大学芸術系准教授 科学万博から街中のイスまで幅広い分野を繋ぎ環境デザインを行う設計者であり、プレイスメイキングを主軸に取り組む研究者。居心地や楽しさ、暖かさを重視する居場所作りに取り組み、全国で実践と針師的助言に励んでいる。

sp3.name: Yusuke Kimura
sp3.position: シェアトレ 代表 / 筑波大学体育専門学群3年
sp3.description: 筑波大学体育専門学群3年 筑波大学3年次を休学中。スポーツ教育の機会均等を志す。 現在、体育会サッカー部に所属しながらサッカー指導者のための練習メニュー共有サイト「シェアトレ」を運営。

sp4.name: Yuto Matoba
sp4.position: 学生サークル「体和塾」代表 / 筑波大学人文・文化学群比較文化学類3年
sp4.description: 筑波大学人文・文化学群比較文化学類3年 高校時代から武術や禅に惹かれ、大学入学後、カラダを通した学びの場を作ろうと、学生サークル「体和塾」を設立。 2年次にはインドにてヨガの指導者資格を取得し、ヨガティーチャーとしても活動中。

concept.title: Theme
concept.description: イベントのテーマは、"moving" です。TEDxUTsukubaは筑波大学の中に溢れる価値あるアイデアと人々のつながりを通じて、新たなアイデアが生まれ広がっていくような場所を目指しています。このイベントを通して、今回のトークが参加者の心を動かすこと”moving talk”、さらに今回のイベントへの参加がきっかけとなって何か変化や行動を起こすこと"start moving"を期待して"moving"というコンセプトにしました。スピーカ―によるアイデア溢れるトークをどうぞお楽しみください。
concept.headline: moving

venue.title: Venue
venue.headline: 筑波大学 総合研究棟 A110
venue.description: 大学院重点化に対応する総合研究棟として、キャンパス・リニューアル計画の核となる施設整備プロジェクト。教育研究の高度化と幅広い分野が融合する施設を目指した。小さな情報発信基地となるガラス張りの教官室、知的交流と休息の場となる二層吹き抜けの研究交流ラウンジ、四方に開かれた玄関には出会いと情報発信の場となる明るく開放的なギャラリーを配置。自由闊達な情報発信と交流を促進する施設となっている。（株式会社 類設計室 公式ウェブサイトより）
venue.access: つくば駅A3出口より、つくばセンターバスターミナル6番乗り場から筑波大学中央行きまたは筑波大学循環(左回り)バスで「筑波大学中央」下車、バス停より徒歩1分。

events.title: Event Listing
events.subtitle: Explore our upcoming events that bring people together to listen, learn and talk.

othertedx.title: TEDx events worldwide
othertedx.quote: Attending TEDx events brings you opportunities to uncover new ideas and the latest research in your local areas that spark conversations in your communities.
othertedx.description: TEDx events are happening in more than 170 countries (including virtual events) every day. Attend a TEDx event near you featuring live speakers and TED Talk videos, sparking conversation and connections.
